page.title: 04Radwell village.
page.content: Radwell is a small hamlet due North of Norton.Most of the houses are lived in by land owners and farm workers.There are no shops.The church is called All Saints Church and was founded about 1218 as a stone structure.Over the years it has been added to and in Victorian times it was reroofed.There are still some 16th and 17th centuary memorials in the church.The Northern family are the largest land owners,they farm approx.636 acres.These are some of the crops they grow in this area:- wheat,barley,pototoes,beans and peas.The Northerns and Meredith-Hardys also rear pigs.Radwell Mill is owned by the Meredith-Hardys,it was used as a mill until 1955.Mr.Meredith-Hardy is a lawyer in London and goes there every day on his motorbike.
